meanings.definition: Whews (verb): to make a high-pitched sound expressing relief or exhaustion
meanings.sent1: After finishing the race, she whews loudly, feeling relieved.
meanings.sent2: I always whews after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: The cat whews when it finally catches the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: The whistle of the wind through the trees sounded like a soft whews.
meanings.sent5: The child's whews echoed through the empty hallway, signaling the end of a long day.

meanings.definition: Whews (noun): a sound made to express relief or exhaustion
meanings.sent1: The whews of the exhausted hiker could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: When she finally finished her exam, a loud whews escaped her lips.
meanings.sent3: The whews of the deflating balloon sounded comical in the silent room.
meanings.sent4: His sigh of relief was like a gentle whews in the quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The whews of the kettle as it boiled signaled the start of a cozy tea time.
